original_title: Sri Lanka rupee at Rs307/310 to US dollar, bond yields down
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened at 307.00/312.00 to the US dollar on Friday dealers said, while bond and t-bill yields were down.
The Spot US dollar closed at 307.00/310.00 rupees on Thursday after interventions around 314 to the US dollar and moral suasion, market participants said.

After heavy dollar purchases by the central bank in recent weeks, a mismatch was seen for imports. Mismatches generally end up in large import bills like oil. Unless there are two way interventions, timing differences in inflows and outflows cannot be matched, analysts say.
The central bank in June also started reverse repo injections which can help cash short banks give loans without real deposits, creating sudden demand for dollars, even if some banks are plus.
The central bank injected 25.5 billion rupees overnight in to the market at 13.47 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 22.95/23.05 percent, down from 23.00/20 percent a day earlier.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 was quoted at 24.75/25.25 percent, unchanged.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2025 was quoted at 26.90/27.10 percent. down from 27.00/75 percent.
A one year bill quoted at 17.25.18.00 percent, down from 18.25/19.00 percent at its last close.
